text: Wolfgang Uhlmann (29 March 1935 - 24 August 2020) was a German chess grandmaster. He was East Germany's most successful professional chess player. He won the German Democratic Republic (GDR) national championship 11 times from 1954 to 1986. He was the GDR's most outstanding player at the Chess Olympiads of 1956â€“1990, where he made 11 appearances. At the 1964 event in Tel Aviv, he scored a combined 15 points out of 18, earning him the individual board one gold medal. An individual bronze medal, for a combined score of 13 points out of 18, followed in 1966 at Havana. Uhlmann died on 24 August 2020 from a fall, aged 85. ==References== Category:1935 births Category:2020 deaths Category:German chess players Category:Chess grandmasters
title: Wolfgang Uhlmann
